catalog.name: Energy estimates
catalog.description: This collection reports the estimate of descriptive summary indicators of the energy system, also at the local scale, useful not only for characterizing the current state of the energy system but also for analyzing the possible future developments of generation from RES. An example of this is the self-sufficiency index, defined with the aim of highlighting the propensity of each individual municipality for energy independence from distributed generation RES plants that are operating in the same area.

members.name: Self-sufficiency index
members.description:
Ratio between municipal RES production and municipal electricity consumption. Year 2015, MT and BT.

This index provides general indications on the level of local generation from Renewable Energy Sources, compared to consumption in the same territorial context.

The Energy Self-sufficiency Indicator (IAE) is calculated as the ratio between the generation produced by RES plants located in the municipal area connected to the distribution network and the residential electricity consumption of the same municipality.

Municipal RES production is calculated as follows:

  • determination of the operating power for the individual RES technologies in each municipality, in the reference year. Power plants below 6 MW are considered for estimating the power connected to the MT and BT network;

  • estimate of equivalent annual hours of operation (h_equ) for each RES technology and for each municipality.
    Estimates are based on processing of GSE data.

View the production map

The municipal electricity consumption is estimated starting from the published data on provincial electricity consumption of the economic macro-sectors‚Äù, which can be found in the statistics/electricity consumption of electricity by product sector on Terna's website.
The provincial consumption data are divided among the municipalities of the province on the basis of the resident population (ISTAT data for the reference year), as regards the domestic sector, and on the basis of the employees employed in the individual municipalities, as regards the agricultural sectors , industry and services (ISTAT Census 2011 data).

View the provincial consumption map

The application of the scenario index of future development of distributed generation provides a quantitative indication of how a municipality could support the energy consumption attributable to human activities carried out on its territory with only the production of electricity from operational distributed generation RES plants on the territory itself.
Additional information: Atlante Integrato per il Sistema Energetico Nazionale e le fonti rinnovabili (ai:SEN) - Rapporto RSE 18007806
